intro: Floerkea alba, commonly known as white floerkea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a velvety texture. Floerkea alba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
